meanings.definition: The marks used in writing to separate sentences, clauses, etc.
meanings.sent1: I always remember to use punctuation at the end of my sentences.
meanings.sent2: In English, punctuation marks like commas and periods are very important.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's pet cat, Paws, loves to play with punctuation marks.
meanings.sent4: The punctuation in her speech added clarity to her message.
meanings.sent5: The lack of punctuation made the text confusing and hard to read.

meanings.definition: The act or practice of inserting standardized marks in written matter to clarify meaning.
meanings.sent1: Proper punctuation helps to make writing easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: She studied the rules of punctuation to improve her writing skills.
meanings.sent3: The detective's punctuation of evidence led to the capture of the criminal.
meanings.sent4: Her punctuation of emotions in the letter made her feelings clear.
meanings.sent5: The punctuation of colors in the painting created a beautiful harmony.
